tuv.seg: Children and the criminal justice system
Leanaí agus an córas ceartais choiriúil
Children are among the most vulnerable members of society
Tá leanaí in Éirinn ar na daoine is soghonta sa tsochaí
The law of the state protects children until they are deemed to be able to interact in society as adults
Cosnaíonn dlí an stáit leanaí go dtí go meastar go bhfuil siad in ann idirghníomhú leis an tsochaí mar dhaoine fásta
For this reason children are treated differently from adults by the criminal justice system
Mar gheall air sin, ní dhéileálann an córas ceartais choiriúil in Éirinn le leanaí ar an mbealach céanna ar a ndéileálann sé le daoine fásta

The law which deals with children found in breach of the criminal law is contained in the Children Act, 2001 which was amended by the Criminal Justice Act 2006, the Children (Amendment) Act 2015 and other acts
Tá an dlí a dhéileálann le leanaí a sháraíonn dlí coiriúil le fáil in Acht na Leanaí, 2001 arna leasú ag an Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006
The Children Act 2001 Act became law in July 2001 and since then most of the provisions of the 2001 Act and the amendments have been brought into force
Tháinig Acht na Leanaí 2001 i bhfeidhm sa dlí i mí Iúil 2001 agus ó shin cuireadh formhór na bhforálacha ó Acht 2001 agus na leasuithe i bhfeidhm
The 2001 legislation is based on the philosophy that children in conflict with the law should only be detained (custody) by the state as a last resort
Tá reachtaíocht 2001 bunaithe ar fhealsúnacht nár chóir don stát leanaí i gcoinbhleacht leis an dlí a choinneáil (caomhnadh) ach mar rogha deiridh
There are many community based measures which must be explored and exhausted before detention can be considered
Tá a lán beart pobalbhunaithe ar chóir féachaint orthu agus leas a bhaint astu sular féidir smaoineamh faoi leanbh a choinneáil
There were three Departments of the Government with the responsibility for overseeing the implementation of the Children Act, 2001
Bhí trí Roinn Rialtais le freagracht as maoirseacht a dhéanamh ar chur i bhfeidhm Acht na Leanaí, 2001
• Department of Justice and Equality
• An Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais
• Department of Education and Skills
• An Roinn Oideachais agus Scileanna
The Office of the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs was set up in December 2005 to bring greater coherence to policy-making for children
Bunaíodh Oifig an Aire Leanaí agus Gnóthaí Óige i mí na Nollag 2005 chun comhleanúnachas níos mó a chothú maidir le beartais a dhéanamh do leanaí
While it was part of the Department of Health it also included units from the two other departments, such as the Irish Youth Justice Service
Cé go raibh sé mar chuid den Roinn Sláinte áiríodh sé freisin aonaid ón dá roinn eile cosúil le Seirbhís Ceartais Óige na hÉireann
The Irish Youth Justice Service was established in December 2005 within the Department of Justice and Equality
Bunaíodh Seirbhís Ceartais Óige na hÉireann i mí na Nollag 2005 laistigh den Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais
The Service brought together all of the State's youth justice services in one place
Cur an tSeirbhís seirbhísí ceartais óige uile an Stáit ar fáil le chéile in áit amháin
It provided strategic direction to the development of services and promote necessary reforms
Thug sé treoir straitéiseach d'fhorbairt seirbhísí agus cothóidh sé leasuithe riachtanacha
In June 2011, the Department of Children and Youth Affairs was established
I mí an Mheithimh 2011, bunaíodh an Roinn Leanaí agus Gnóthaí Óige
It took over the functions of the Office of the Minister for Children and Youth Affairs
Thóg sé breis agus feidhmeanna na Oifig an Aire Leanaí agus Gnóthaí Óige
Certain units from other departments also became part of the new Department, such as the Irish Youth Justice Service
Bhí aonaid áirithe ó Ranna eile mar chuid na Roinne nua cosúil le Seirbhís Ceartais Óige na hÉireann
Definition of a child in criminal law
Sainmhíniú ar leanbh sa dlí coiriúil
Until the introduction of the Children Act 2001 many expressions were used to identify someone within the scope of the juvenile justice system
Go dtí gur tugadh Acht na Leanaí 2001 isteach, baineadh úsáid as a lán nathanna éagsúla chun daoine a aithint a bhí laistigh de scóip an chórais cheartais ógánach
Expressions such as minor, juvenile, youth offender and young person were commonplace
Baineadh úsáid fhorleathan as nathanna cosúil le mionúr, ógánach, ciontóir óg agus duine óg
However, the word child is now defined by Section 3 of the 2001 Act to mean a person under the age of 18 years
Anois, áfach, sainmhíníonn Alt 3 d'Acht 2001 an focal leanbh mar dhuine faoi bhun 18 mbliana d'aois
The Children Act 2001 does not distinguish between a child and a young person
Ní dhéanann Acht na Leanaí 2001 idirdhealú idir leanbh agus duine óg
Any provisions in earlier Acts distinguishing different classes of children (for example, young persons, minors, child) no longer exist
Níl aon fhorálacha in Achtanna níos luaithe a dhéanann idirdhealú idir ranganna éagsúla leanaí (mar shampla, daoine óga, mionúir, leanbh) ann níos mó
Age of criminal responsibility
Aois na freagrachta coiriúla
The age of criminal responsibility is covered by Section 52 of the Children Act 2001 as amended by Section 129 of the Criminal Justice Act 2006
Clúdaíonn Alt 52 d'Acht na Leanaí 2001 arna leasú ag Alt 129 den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006 aois na freagrachta coiriúla
This came into effect in October 2006, raising the age of criminal responsibility from 7 years of age to 12 years of age
Tháinig sé sin i bhfeidhm i mí Dheireadh Fómhair 2006, agus d'ardaigh sé aois na freagrachta coiriúla ó 7 mbliana d'aois go dtí 12 bhliain d'aois
This means that children who have not reached the age of 12 years cannot be charged with an offence
Ciallaíonn sé sin nach féidir cion a chur i leith leanaí faoi bhun aois 12 bhliain
There is an exception, however, for children aged 10 or 11 who can be charged with murder, manslaughter, rape or aggravated sexual assault
Tá eisceacht ann, áfach, do leanaí ag aois 10 nó 11, mar is féidir iad a chúiseamh i ndúnmharú, dúnorgain, éigniú nó tromionsaí gnéasach
In addition, where a child under 14 years of age is charged with an offence, no further proceedings can be taken without the consent of the Director of Public Prosecutions
Chomh maith leis sin, nuair a chúisítear leanbh faoi bhun 14 bliana d'aois i gcion, ní féidir aon imeachtaí breise a dhéanamh gan toiliú an Stiúrthóra Ionchúiseamh Poiblí
Although the 2001 Act in general prohibits children under 12 years of age from being charged and convicted of a criminal offence, they do not enjoy total immunity from action being taken against them

Cé go gcuireann Acht 2001 cosc ginearálta ar leanaí faoi bhun 12 bhliain d'aois a chúiseamh agus a chiontú i gcion coiriúil, níl díolúine iomlán ag na leanaí sin ó ghníomhartha a bheith déanta ina gcoinne

Section 53 of the Act as amended by Section 130 of the Criminal Justice Act 2006 places an onus on the Gardai to take a child under 12 years of age to his/her parents or guardian, where they have reasonable grounds for believing that the child has committed an offence with which the child cannot be charged due to the child’s age

Leagann Alt 53 den Acht arna leasú ag Alt 130 den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006 dualgas ar na Gardaí leanbh faoi bhun 12 bhliain d'aois a thabhairt chuig a t(h)uismitheoirí nó a c(h)aomhnóir má tá cúis réasúnach ag na Gardaí a chreideamh go bhfuil an leanbh ciontach i gcion nach féidir an leanbh a chiontú as mar gheall ar aois an linbh
Where this is not possible the Gardai will arrange for the child to be taken into the custody of the Child and Family Agency (Tusla) for the area in which the child normally resides
Nuair nach bhfuil sé sin indéanta, eagróidh na Gardaí go gcuirfear an leanbh faoi choimeád An Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach (Tusla) don cheantar ina bhfuil gnáthchónaí ar an leanbh
It is possible that children under 12 years of age who commit criminal offences will be dealt with by Tusla and not the criminal justice system
Is féidir le Tusla déileáil le leanaí faoi bhun 12 bhliain d'aois a dhéanann cionta coiriúla in ionad an chórais cheartais choiriúil
Under Section 142 of the Children Act 2001, a court may impose a period of detention on a child
Faoi Alt 142 d'Acht na Leanaí 2001, féadann cúirt tréimhse coinneála a chur i bhfeidhm ar leanbh
Children between the ages of 10 and 16 sentenced by the courts to a period of detention are sent to the Oberstown Children Detention Campus
Nuair atá an leanbh faoi bhun 16 bliana d'aois, coinnítear an leanbh i scoil coinneála leanaí
17-year-olds sentenced after 31 March 2017 are also sent to the Oberstown Children Detention Campus
Coinnítear leanaí 16 bliana agus 17 mbliana d'aois in ionaid choinneála leanaí
You can find out more in our document on the detention of children
Tá níos mó faisnéise faoi choinneáil leanaí agus daoine óga anseo

Under Section 258 of the Children Act 2001 an offence committed by a child under the age of 18, for which they have been found guilty, can be automatically expunged from the record as if never committed, once certain conditions are met

Faoi Alt 258 d’Acht na Leanaí, 2001, féadtar cion a dhéanann leanbh faoi aois 18, ar deimhníodh go raibh siad ciontach ina leith, a dhíscríobh go huathoibríoch ón taifead amhail nár tharla sé, a luaithe a chomhlíontar roinnt coinníollacha
The conditions are as follows:
Is iad seo a leanas na coinníollacha:
• The offence was committed before the child reached the age of 18 years
• Rinneadh an cion sular bhain an leanbh aois 18 mbliana amach
• The offence is not one required to be tried by the Central Criminal Court (such as murder or rape)
• Ní cion atá sa chion ar gá don Phríomh-Chúirt Choiriúil é a thriail (ar nós cion dúnmharaithe nó éignithe)
• At least 3 years have elapsed since the finding of guilt and
• Tá ar a laghad 3 bliana caite ó deimhníodh an chiontacht agus
• The child has not been dealt with for another offence in that 3-year period
• Níor déileáladh leis an leanbh mar gheall ar chion eile sa tréimhse 3 bliana sin
If these conditions are met, they are no longer regarded under Irish law as having committed an offence
Má chomhlíontar na coinníollacha seo, ní chaitear leo, faoi dhlí na hÉireann, amhail go ndearna siad cion
If they have received a caution or have been dealt with under the Probation of Offenders Act 1907, Section 258 also applies
Má tugadh rabhadh dóibh nó má déileáladh leo faoin Acht um Promhadh Ciontóirí, 1907, beidh feidhm ag Alt 258 chomh maith
When looking for employment or applying for an educational course or insurance, they can claim to have a clean record
Nuair a bhíonn fostaíocht á cuardach nó nuair a bhíonn iarratas á dhéanamh ar chúrsa oideachais nó ar árachas, féadfaidh siad a mhaíomh go bhfuil taifead gan locht acu
However, if they are travelling or emigrating to a country such as the USA or Australia, they are subject to that country’s immigration laws and may have to disclose such convictions

Má bhíonn siad ag taisteal nó ag dul ar imirce chuig tír ar nós SAM nó na hAstráile, áfach, beidh siad faoi réir dhlíthe inimirce na tíre sin agus d’fhéadfadh go mbeadh orthu na ciontuithe siúd a nochtadh
